title: Hey Hey It's Saturday
creator_credit: United Media and Somers Carroll Productions
brief_description: Hey Hey It’s Saturday was a long-running variety television program on Australian television. It initially ran for 27 years, from 1971 to 1999. Its host throughout its entire run was Daryl Somers.

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

description: Hey Hey It’s Saturday was a long-running variety television program on Australian television. It initially ran for 27 years, debuting on the Nine Network on 9 October 1971 and broadcasting its last episode on 20 November 1999. Its host throughout its entire run was Daryl Somers, who would later become executive producer of the program. The original producer, Gavin Disney, left the program in the 1980s and Somers then jointly formed his own production company, Somers Carroll Productions, with on-screen partner Ernie Carroll, the performer of Somers’ puppet sidekick Ossie Ostrich.
